title: PLEASE HELP! what is this font used for a Herman Hesse book cover
content:
does anyone know what font the word HESSE is ?????? i need to find out abit urgently!!!  
thankyou.  
xxx

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123033051im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/hessefont_5733.jpg)

 [‹ old style font - hoctaw](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123033051/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40769 "Go to previous forum topic") [what is the font this logo? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123033051/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40763 "Go to next forum topic")
author: neill k

comments.content:
Hi Neill,

that look s like a version of Binner.  
F

thanks Florian, yes it does seem to be some version of Binner but the ’S’ is very different, i thought maybe it was some sort of Binner narrow or condensed but i cant find it in that form anywhere.....does it even exist in condensed??? are there any other fonts that are similar to Binner that it would be worth checking???  
thanks for posting!!!  
neill
How old is this cover? It’s likely that this is a pre-digital typeface.
I wouldn’t be surprised if it was hand-drawn either.

thanks for posting guys, not sure exactly how old the cover is...was just sent this by a client, looks like its off a penguin book from the 70’s.....  
i reckon hand drawn is a distinct possibility........oh well.  
thanks for having a look at it!

Appears in the Solotype catalogue as Brush Sans Outline & Brush Sans Rimmed.

David Farey created Brush Sans Rimmed Condensed which is available.

[http://www.identifont.com/show?3VL](http://web.archive.org/web/20081123033051/http:/www.identifont.com/show?3VL "http://www.identifont.com/show?3VL")
